data.scheme_name: Section 10: Composition Levy for goods or services or both - Existing
data.benefits:
Simplified Compliance: Quarterly returns (CMP-08) instead of monthly filings.
Reduced Tax Liability: Fixed lower tax rates.
Ease of Operations: No detailed record-keeping of ITC and tax calculations.
data.eligibility:
1. Businesses (Other than service providers) with an aggregate turnover of Rs. 150 Lakhs or less in the preceding financial year (Rs. 75 lakhs for specified states). 
  2. For service providers, turnover must be up to Rs. 50 lakhs. 
  3. The taxpayer must not: Engage in inter-state supplies. 
  4. Supply exempt goods or services. Supply goods or services through e-commerce operators liable for TCS. 
  5. Following are not eligilble: Casual taxable persons (occasionally supplying in a State/UT without a fixed business place). 
  6. Non-resident taxable persons (occasionally supplying but without a fixed business place or residence in India). 
  7. Persons engaged in inter-state supply of goods or services. 
  8. Persons supplying non-taxable goods under GST law. Persons supplying goods through e-commerce operators required to collect tax at source under Section 52. 
  9. Manufacturers of notified goods such as ice cream, pan masala, tobacco, and aerated waters.
data.conditions:
1. Must register under the Composition Scheme via the GST portal. 
  2. Issue bills of supply in the prescribed manner. Pay all taxes on purchases, including those under reverse charge. 
  3. Do not claim ITC on purchases. 
  4. Display "Composition Taxable Person" prominently at every business location. 
  5. Withdraw from the scheme if eligibility criteria are not met. 
  6. Tax cannot be collected from customers, as taxpayers must issue a bill of supply instead of a tax invoice. 
  7. Hence, their buyers cannot claim credit for taxes paid. Cannot make inter-state supplies. 
  8. File quarterly CMP-08 returns and pay taxes on time. 
  9. Annual return (GSTR-4) submission is mandatory for continued eligibility.

data.nodal_agency: Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs
data.context:
• The Composition Scheme was introduced to simplify GST compliance for small taxpayers who face challenges managing complex filing and record-keeping processes. 
  • It aims to ease their tax burden and compliance requirements, fostering growth for Micro enterprises
data.objective: To simplify GST compliance for small taxpayers by allowing them to pay tax at a fixed rate on turnover without claiming Input Tax Credit (ITC).
data.description:
1. Simplified Compliance: Under the normal GST scheme, taxpayers must file multiple monthly/quarterly and annual returns and upload invoice details, which can be challenging for small businesses. 
  2. The Composition Scheme simplifies this by requiring only quarterly tax payments (CMP-08) and an annual return filing, reducing the compliance burden and allowing businesses to focus on growth. 
  3. Ease of Operations: The Composition Scheme eliminates the need for detailed record-keeping of ITC and complex tax calculations. 
  4. Taxpayers only need to calculate a fixed percentage of their turnover as tax, making it easy to manage compliance with minimal administrative effort.
  5. Reduce tax liability: 
    • Another advantage of being registered with Composition Levy scheme is the rate structure. 
    • While most of the services fall under either 12% or 18% GST bracket, Composition service providers need to pay tax as per the below rates:
      1.  1% for manufacturers and traders (0.5% CGST + 0.5% SGST/ UTGST). 
      2. 5% for restaurant services (2.5% CGST + 2.5% SGST/ UTGST) 
      3. 6% for service providers opting for the composition scheme (3% CGST + 3% SGST/ UTGST).
data.how_to_apply:
1. New Registration: Can opt for the scheme while applying for GST registration. 
  2. Existing Taxpayers: Must file Form GST CMP-02 before the start of the financial year.
data.funding_facilitator: Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs
data.funding_mechanism:
1. To avail the benefits of this section after application, one must file: CMP-08 form quarterly to report tax liability and pay taxes. 
  2. Annual GSTR-4 to summarize yearly activity and tax liability.
data.additional_info: Aggregate turnover includes the value of all taxable supplies, exempt supplies, export supplies, and inter-state supplies, excluding CGST, SGST, IGST, and cess.
